intro: Nebropsis ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, and it produces slender, elongated pods that contain seeds. Nebropsis ochroleuca is generally a short-lived perennial, though it may behave as an annual in certain regions.
